definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of lymph, a bodily fluid consisting of a usually clear coagulable fluid that passes from intercellular spaces of body tissue into the lymphatic vessels, is discharged into the blood by way of the thoracic duct and right lymphatic duct, and resembles blood plasma in containing white blood cells and especially lymphocytes but normally few red blood cells and no platelets.

label: interstitial fluid material
definition: A bodily fluid material which is composed primarily of interstitial fluid, a bodily fluid consisting of a solution which bathes and surrounds the cells of multicellular animals. It is the main component of the extracellular fluid, which also includes plasma and transcellular fluid.

label: siliceous ooze
definition: Siliceous ooze is a marine sediment composed of the debris of plankton with silica shells, such as diatoms and radiolaria. This ooze is limited to areas with high biological productivity, such as the polar oceans, and upwelling zones near the equator. The least common type of sediment, it covers only 15% of the ocean floor. It accumulates at a slower rate than calcareous ooze: 0.2-1 cm / 1000 yr.

label: red clay
definition: Red clay, also known as pelagic clay, accumulates in the deepest and most remote areas of the ocean. Containing less than 30% biogenic material, its composition is a varied mix of very fine quartz and clay minerals, authigenic deposits precipitated directly from seawater, and micrometeorites. Though called "red" because it sometimes takes the color of oxidized iron minerals, it is usually brownish in color. Its ultimate origin is uncertain, but red clay seems to be mostly derived from distant rivers, and windblown dust. Covering 38% of the ocean floor, it accumulates more slowly than any other sediment type, at only 0.1-0.5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: calcareous ooze
definition: Calcareous ooze is a marine sediment composed primarily of the shells--also known as tests--of foraminifera, coccolithophores, and pteropods. This is the most common pelagic sediment by area, covering 48% of the world ocean's floor. This type of ooze is limited to depths above the Carbonate Compensation Depth at time of burial. It accumulates more rapidly than any other pelagic sediment type, with a rate that varies from 0.3 - 5 cm / 1000 yr.

label: animal feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of animals, particularly livestock such as cattle, goats, sheep, horses, chickens and pigs.

label: contaminated animal feed
definition: Contaminated animal feed is an animal feed that has become contaminated with or come contact with microorganisms or toxic chemicals.

label: hide
definition: A skin obtained from animals for human use typically from deer or cattle sources used to produce leather, shoes, fashion accessories, musical instruments.

label: bone meal
definition: A mixture of crushed and coarsely ground bones that is used as an organic fertilizer for plants and formerly in animal feed.

label: plant feed
definition: Food material which can be used to meet nutritional requirements of plants.

label: surface soil
definition: A soil consisting of the upper layer of soil on the surface consisting of loose material capable of supporting life composed of a mixture of mineral and organic matter.

label: ash
definition: An environmental material that is the non-aqueous, non-gaseous residues that remain after something is burned.

label: coal
definition: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock usually occurring in rock strata in layers or veins called coal beds or coal seams.

label: ore
definition: a type of rock that contains sufficient minerals with important elements including metals that can be economically extracted from the rock.

label: uranium ore
definition: Ore which contains uranium.

label: coal dust
definition: Dust which is derived from coal.

label: mineral dust
definition: Dust which is derived from mineral material.

label: fibrous dust
definition: Dust which is composed of fibrous material.

label: metallic dust
definition: Dust which is composed primarily of some metallic material.

label: clay dust
definition: Dust which is derived from clay material.

label: grain dust
definition: Dust that comes from grain and all the other substances associated with its cultivation & harvesting.

label: fume
definition: A gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.

label: vanadium fume
definition: Respirable vapor of vanadium.

label: natural wax
definition: A wax that is naturally synthesized by a plant or animal.

label: paraffin wax
definition: A white or colourless soft solid derivable from petroleum, coal or oil shale, that consists of a mixture of hydrocarbon molecules containing between twenty and forty carbon atoms.

label: oil shale
definition: An organic-rich fine-grained sedimentary rock containing kerogen from which liquid hydrocarbons called shale oil can be produced.

label: paint
definition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

label: lead paint
definition: Paint that contains lead.

label: wood ash
definition: the residue powder that is derived from the combustion of wood.

label: coal ash
definition: Ash that is produced from the burning of coal.

label: fly ash
definition: A very fine, powdery material composed mostly of silica made from the burning of finely ground coal in a boiler.

label: bottom ash
definition: a coarse, angular ash particle that is too large to be carried up into the smoke stacks so it forms in the bottom of the coal furnace.

label: boiler slag
definition: molten bottom ash from slag tap and cyclone type furnaces that turns into pellets that have a smooth glassy appearance after it is cooled with water.

label: flue gas desulfurization material
definition: a material leftover from the process of reducing sulfur dioxide emissions from a coal-fired boiler that can be a wet sludge consisting of calcium sulfite or calcium sulfate or a dry powered material that is a mixture of sulfites and sulfates.

label: mangrove biome soil
definition: Soil which is located in a mangrove biome.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: A liquid or a gas.

label: neve
definition: Partially compacted granular snow, which has undergone several cycles of melting and refreezing while being compacted, usually found on the atmosphere-exposed surface of a glacier.

label: firn
definition: Granular snow which contains a proportion of fused granules formed through melting and re-thawing while being compacted by the weight of overlying material and which contains interconnected gaseous pores.

label: glacial ice
definition: Any water ice that is part of a glacier.

label: erosionally enriched glacial ice
definition: Glacial ice which contains material liberated during a glacial erosion process.

label: blue ice
definition: Water ice containing little to no air bubbles resulting in a reduction of internal light scattering and, given sufficient volume, a blue appearance.

label: soot
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of carbon particles formed through the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.

label: erosionally enriched ice
definition: Water ice which contains material liberated during an erosion process.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: marine sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported through the marine water column, settling on the seafloor.

label: shallow marine sediment
definition: Marine sediment soured from either terrestrial systems, marine organisms, seawater and or cosmogeneous sources, which is transported through the marine water column, and accumulates within shallow regions of the oceanic basin close to continents, such as the continental shelf, or continental slope.

label: cryoconite deposit
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of dust, rock, and soot, as well as the microbial communities associated with these materials, deposited on an ice mass by an aeolian process.

label: frazil ice
definition: New ice which is composed frazil which has congealed into a thin sheet.

label: new ice
definition: Water ice which is formed from freezing water and is suspended in a water body.

label: first year ice
definition: Sea ice which has formed over a single freezing season.

label: second year ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than first year ice, and has survived a seasonal melting process.

label: multiyear ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than second year ice, and has survived more than two seasonal melting process.

label: shuga
definition: New ice, which is spongy, lumpy and opaque, and forms from water which freezes in an agitated water body.

label: slush ice
definition: A slurry of frazil, snow, and liquid water.

label: methane-laden permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains pockets of trapped methane gas.

label: slab snow
definition: Snow which is cohesive, hard and overlies weaker snow.

label: agricultural potting mixture
definition: An agricultural environmental material which 1) is composed of a mixture of materials such as peat, composted bark, sand, perlite, or compost, and 2) serves as a medium in which to grow plants.

label: freezing fog
definition: A fog the droplets of which freeze upon contact with exposed objects, forming a coating of rime or glaze.

label: ice fog
SYNONYMS: air hoar|frost flakes|frost fog|frozen fog|ice-crystal fog|pogonip|rime fog
definition: Fog which is composed of particles of ice.

label: chicken manure
definition: Poultry manure made of chicken feces.

label: gypsum
definition: A soft sulfate mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate.

label: litter
definition: Environmental material consisting of waste products that have been discarded at an unsuitable location.

label: manure
definition: An environmental material consisting of organic matter from plants and/or animals that is used in agriculture as fertilizer.

label: cork
definition: Plant matter consisting of an impermeable buoyant material, the phellem layer of bark tissue.

label: natural-based polymer
definition: Macromolecules that are obtained naturally from plants or animals.

label: cellophane
definition: A thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose.

label: pliofilm
definition: Synthetic plastic which is composed of a glossy, moistureproof membrane made of rubber hydrochloride.

label: mylar
definition: A polyester film made from stretched polyethylene terephthalate (PET).

label: ceramic
definition: A solid environmental material that is hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant, made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral at a high temperature.

label: latex
SYNONYMS: Natural rubber, India rubber, Gum elastic, Non-vulcanized rubber
definition: A stable dispersion (emulsion) of polymer microparticles in an aqueous medium.

label: stagnant water
definition: A liquid water which has no current or flow and is susceptible to contamination by pathogens or pathogenic vectors.

label: wood dust
definition: Dust which is 1) generated when wood is processed and 2) composed primarily of cellulose, polyoses, and lignin.

label: diesel fuel
definition: A liquid fuel used in diesel engines, whose fuel ignition takes place, without any spark, as a result of compression of the inlet air mixture and then injection of fuel.

label: gasoline
definition: A clear petroleum-derived flammable liquid which is used as fuel in most spark-ignited internal combustion engines.

label: diesel exhaust
definition: A gas which results from the incomplete or complete combustion of diesel fuel.

label: gasoline exhaust
definition: A gas which results from the complete or incomplete combustion of gasoline fuel.

label: xanthan gum
definition: A polysaccharide that functions as an emulsifier, stabilizer, and thickener in mixtures.

label: tragacanth
definition: A naturally occurring plant-based gum, which functions as a viscous, odorless, tasteless, water-soluble mixture of polysaccharides that absorbs water to become a gel/paste.

label: resin
definition: A solid or highly viscous plant or synthetic based substance that is typically convertible into polymers.

label: shellac
definition: A resin secreted by the female lac bug, which is dissolved in alcohol to be used as a brush-on colorant, food glaze, and wood finish.

label: primer (paint)
definition: A paint product which adheres to surfaces and forms a binding layer, preparing it to receive paint.

label: oil-based paint
definition: A slow-drying paint that consists of particles of pigment suspended in a drying oil, commonly linseed oil.

label: acrylic paint
definition: A water soluble, fast-drying paint made of pigment suspended in acrylic polymer emulsion.

label: luminescent paint
definition: A paint that exhibits luminescence, giving off visible light through fluorescence, phosphorescence, or radioluminescence.

label: rock dust
definition: Dust which is composed of minerals and trace elements, generated by  finely crushed rock.

label: radioactive material
definition: Any material containing unstable atoms that emit ionizing radiation as it decays.

label: volume of cyanoacrylate
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of cyanoacrolate.

label: rubber cement
definition: An environmental material which is composed of elastic polymers mixed in a solvent.

label: methyl cellulose paste
definition: An environmental material which is 1) composed primarily of methyl cellulose and water, and 2) formulated to fix wallpaper to walls.

label: permanent hair dye
definition: An environmental material which is 1) manufactured and 2) primarily composed of hydrogen peroxide and ammonia, and 3) when applied to hair, can alter the natural hair pigments for 6-8 weeks.

label: pharmaceutical ink
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) composed of alcohol, titanium dioxide, and propylene glycol.

label: gel ink
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) composed of copper phthalocyanine, iron oxides, water, and biopolymers.

label: soy ink
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured and 2) primarily composed of soybean oil, as well as pigment, resin, and wax.

label: aqueous inkjet printer ink
definition: A colorant fluid which is 1) manufactured, 2) primarily composed of water, as well as glycol, and dye, and 3) intended for use in inkjet printers.

label: emissions from petroleum combustion
definition: An environmental material which is composed primarily of gases and particles produced by the combustion of petroleum fuels.

label: colorant fluid
definition: A liquid environmental material which 1) contains at least one substance which can act as a chemical colorant.

label: toxic waste
definition: Waste which contains toxic components (e.g., heavy metals or radiation) which can cause harm to organisms and/or the environment.

label: snow crystal
definition: A water ice crystal which is constituted by water molecules aligned in a hexagonal array.

label: chemically contaminated sediment
definition: Sediment which contains some chemical contaminant.

label: cooling water
definition: Liquid water which is a participant in a water cooling process.

label: food waste
definition: A waste material which is primarily composed of uneaten food and removed from the food supply chain.

label: formation fluid
definition: A fluid environmental material which is contained in geologic formations naturally.

label: interstitial water
definition: Liquid water which occurs naturally within the pores of rocks and sediments.

label: bituminous sand
definition: An environmental material which consists of either loose sands or partially consolidated sandstone, containing a naturally occurring mixture of sand, clay, and water, soaked with a dense and extremely viscous form of petroleum.

label: saprolite
definition: Rock which is derived from bedrock through chemical weathering

label: slurry
definition: An environmental material which is composed of insoluble solid particles suspended in a liquid.

label: pathogen-suppressive soil
definition: Soil which has properties that restrict a pathogen's ability to establish itself, persist, or cause disease that results in long-term harm.

label: marine lake water
definition: Liquid water which is either part of or was removed from a marine lake.

label: microbialite
definition: A sedimentary rock which is made of carbonate mud whose formation is mediated by microbes in the benthic zone.

label: spring water
definition: Water which comes from a spring.

label: cloud water
definition: Fresh water which is harvested from cloud.

label: crustal fluid
definition: Fluid environmental material which is present in the continental crust and dictates the nature and extent of crustal deformation.

label: lichen material
definition: An organic material which is derived from lichen mats.

label: lake water
definition: Water which is part of a lake.

label: soil organic matter
definition: Organic material in soil, which consists of plant and animal residues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil organisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.

label: particulate organic matter
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of organic material.

label: particulate organic carbon
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of carbon.

label: particulate organic nitrogen
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of nitrogen.

label: thermoplastic material
definition: An environmental material which is capable of, repeatedly, becoming plastic when heated and hardening again when cooled.

label: foamed plastic
definition: A plastic which has a matrix- or sponge-like structure with numerous, hollow internal spaces.

label: plastic
definition: An environnmental material which 1) is composed primarily of polymers with high molecular mass and 2) once deformed does not spontaneously return to its original shape.

label: natural plastic
definition: Plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by processes whose agents do not include humans or their technologies.

label: synthetic plastic
definition: A plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by a manufacturing process.

label: runoff
definition: Liquid water which 1) flows over land and 2) is not absorbed or retained by the materials if flows over or through.

label: residual water in soil
definition: Liquid water which is present in soils as discontinuous volumnes of water in contact with solid and gaseous components of the soil.

label: treated wastewater
definition: Waste water which was converted into an effluent that can be either returned to the water cycle with minimal environmental issues or reused.

label: desalinated water
definition: Saline water from which minerals have been removed to produce fresh water suitable for human consumption or irrigation.

label: loamy sand
definition: Soil which is primarily composed of sand with silt and clay in progressively smaller proportions.

label: fine sand
definition: Sand which is composed primarily of fine particles.

label: sandy loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: silty loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: sandy clay loam
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: clay loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of clay in its composition.

label: silty clay loam
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: sandy clay
definition: Clay which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: silty clay
definition: Clay which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: marine mucilage
definition: A gelatinous material primarily composed of exopolymeric compounds with colloidal properties, formed through the aggregation of marine snow particles, often found in large sheets,  flocs, and clouds.

label: biochar
definition: charcoal that is used as a soil amendment.

label: lignite
definition: A soft, brown, combustible, sedimentary rock formed from naturally compressed peat.

label: bitumous coal
definition: a relatively soft coal containing a tarlike substance called bitumen or asphalt. It is of higher quality than lignite coal but of poorer quality than anthracite. It is an organic sedimentary rock formed by diagenetic and sub metamorphic compression of peat bog material.

label: anthracite
definition: A hard, compact variety of coal that has a submetallic luster. It has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest energy density of all types of coal and is the highest ranking of coal.

label: coke
definition: Coal heated in the absence of air.

label: food product
definition: Food material for humans and animals which is processed with the intention that it be consumable as a whole or added to other food products.

label: fermented agave juice
definition: The juice products which are made from the fermented sap of the maguey (agave) plant.

label: fermenting sugar cane juice
definition: This food product type includes food products which are made from fermentation of juice extracted from pressed sugarcane.

label: fermenting elaeis palm sap food product
mammalian meat food product
definition: A food product made of meat, the skeletal muscle and associated fat, and other edible tissues such as organs, livers, skin, brains, bone marrow, kidneys, or lungs, of mammals.

label: sausage food product
definition: A processed meat food product that is made from a sausage.

label: hot dog
definition: A hot dog is a moist sausage of soft, even texture and flavor, often made from advanced meat recovery or meat slurry. Most types are fully cooked, cured or smoked. It is often placed hot in a special purpose soft, sliced hot dog bun.

label: processed meat food product
subClassOf [LABEL]: mammalian meat food product|processed food product

label: cheese food product
definition: Cheese is a food derived from milk that is produced in a wide range of flavors, textures, and forms by coagulation of the milk protein casein.

label: yogurt food product
definition: A dairy product produced by bacterial fermentation of milk.

label: plant food product
definition: This class includes food products which are derived from or produced by a plant.

label: cabbage food product
subClassOf [LABEL]: brassica food product|cruciferous inflorescence food product
definition: Cabbage or headed cabbage (comprising several cultivars of Brassica oleracea) is a leafy green or purple biennial plant, grown as an annual vegetable crop for its dense-leaved heads.

label: wort food product
definition: The liquid extracted from the mashing process during the brewing of beer or whiskey. Wort contains the sugars that will be fermented by the brewing yeast to produce alcohol.

label: mammalian milk butter
subClassOf [LABEL]: animal lipid food product|mammalian milk product
definition: Cream component produced by churning and containing not less than 80% milkfat.

label: pickled cabbage food product
subClassOf [LABEL]: cabbage food product|pickled cruciferous food product

label: Brie cheese food product
definition: A large disc of smooth, soft, even runny cheese made with cow's milk.

label: gouda cheese food product
definition: A hard cow's milk cheese with an almost orange yellow paste. Older cheeses are coated in black wax.

label: gorgonzola cheese food product
subClassOf [LABEL]: blue cheese food product|cow milk cheese
definition: A drum of very rich, creamy, pungent blue-veined cow's milk cheese. It has a white paste with blue veining and a brined rind. It is made in Gorgonzola, near Milan.

label: swiss cheese food product
definition: A generic cheese common to many countries for several related varieties of cheese  which resemble the Swiss Emmental. Three types of bacteria are used in the production of Emmental cheese: Streptococcus salivarius subsp. thermophilus, Lactobacillus  (L. helveticus or Lactobacillus delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus), and Propionibacter (P. freudenreichii or P. shermani). In a late stage of cheese production, the Propionibacter consumes the lactic acid excreted by the other bacteria, and releases carbon dioxide gas, which slowly forms the bubbles that develop the eyes. Swiss cheese without eyes is known as "blind."

label: emmenthal cheese food product
definition: A mild, large, yellow, waxy cow's milk cheese with many holes.

label: new zealand cheddar cheese food product
pont ieveque cheese food product
definition: A small, sweetish, soft, square cow's milk cheese from Normandy with a yellowish-orange rind.

label: vacherin mont dor cheese food product
definition: A disc of soft cheese made with cow's milk. It has a soft to runny paste and a smooth, pink rind.

label: pork meat food product
definition: A food product made from domestic pig meat (Sus domesticus or Sus scrofa scrofa).

label: cured meat food product
definition: A meat that is preserved by the addition of a combination of salt, sugar, nitrates  or nitrite and or is smoked.

label: beef food product
definition: Meat from bovines, especially domestic cattle (cows).

label: ice cream food product
subClassOf [LABEL]: confectionery food product|frozen dairy dessert|milk or milk based food product
definition: A frozen dessert usually made from dairy products, such as milk and cream, and often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavours. Most varieties contain sugar, although some are made with other sweeteners. In some cases, artificial flavourings  and colourings are used in addition to (or in replacement of) the natural ingredients. This mixture is stirred slowly while cooling to prevent large ice crystals from forming; the result is a smoothly textured ice cream.

label: animal seafood product
definition: A seafood product is a vertebrate or invertibrate organism from an aquatic environment.

label: pork chop food product
definition: A cut of meat (a meat chop) cut perpendicularly to the spine of the pig and usually containing a rib or part of a vertebra, served as an individual portion.

label: tempeh food product
definition: A food product having tempeh as a defining ingredient

label: fermented fish or seafood food product
flour food product
definition: A fine powder made from cereals or other starchy food sources.

label: plant fruit food product

label: kefir food product
definition: A fermented milk drink made from  milk. It is prepared by inoculating cow, goat, or sheep's milk with kefir grains, a combination of bacteria and yeasts in a matrix of proteins, lipids, and sugars. This symbiotic matrix forms "grains" that resemble cauliflower. Many different bacteria and yeasts are found in the kefir grains, which are a complex and highly variable community of micro-organisms termed probiotics.

The family includes the domestic pig, Sus scrofa domesticus or Sus domesticus, in addition to numerous species of wild pig, such as babirusas and warthogs. All suids, or swine, are native to the Old World, ranging from Asia to Europe and Africa.

label: citrus fruit food product

Unlike pome fruit, such as the apple, the citrus fruit is derived from a superior ovary, an ovary completely separate from the calyx.

label: yam bean food product
definition:
Pachyrhizus erosus, commonly known as jicama Mexican yam bean, or Mexican turnip, is the name of a native Mexican vine, although the name most commonly refers to the plant's edible tuberous root. Jícama is a species in the genus Pachyrhizus in the bean family (Fabaceae). Plants in this genus are commonly referred to as yam bean, although the term "yam bean" can be another name for jícama.

In contrast to the root, the remainder of the jícama plant is very poisonous; the seeds contain the toxin rotenone, which is used to poison insects and fish.

FAO: The yam bean is a legume but unlike its close relatives the soybean and other beans, the yam bean is cultivated for its large, tuberous roots.

label: pulse food product
definition: PULSES are annual leguminous crops yielding from one to 12 grains or seeds of variable size, shape and colour within a pod. They are used for both food and feed. The term "pulses" is limited to crops harvested solely for dry grain, thereby excludingcrops harvested green for food (green peas, green beans, etc.) which are classified as vegetable crops. Also excluded are those crops used mainly for oil extraction (e.g.soybeand and groundnuts) and leguminous crops (e.g. seeds of clover and alfalfa) that are used exclusively for sowing purposes.

definition: A food made from an unleavened dough of wheat or buckwheat  flour and water, sometimes with other ingredients such as eggs and vegetable  extracts.

label: pastry food product

label: cake food product

Cakes normally combine some kind of flour, a sweetening agent (commonly sugar), a binding agent (generally egg, though gluten  or starch  are often used by lacto-vegetarians and vegans), fats (usually butter, shortening, or margarine, although a fruit puree such as applesauce is sometimes substituted to avoid using fat), a liquid (milk, water or fruit juice), flavors and some form of leavening agent (such as yeast or baking powder), though many cakes lack these ingredients and instead rely on air bubbles in the dough to expand and cause the cake to rise. Codex Alimentarius, Volume 2 - 1993, Section 2:  Pesticide Residues in Food.

The Codex Classification of food and animal feed commodities moving in trade and the description of the various items and groups of food and animal feedstuffs included in the present document have been developed by the Codex Committee on Pesticide Residues. It was first adopted by the 18th Session of the Codex Alimentarius Commission, (1989).

The Codex Classification includes food commodities and animal feedstuffs for which Codex maximum residue limits will not necessarily be established. The Classification is intended to be as complete a listing of food commodities in trade as possible, classified into groups on the basis of the commodity's similar potential for pesticide residues.

The Classification may also be appropriate for other purposes such as setting maximum levels for other types of residues or for other contaminants in food. The Codex Classification should be consulted in order to obtain a precise description of the food or animal feed commodities and, especially, in cases where Codex maximum residue limits have been set for groups of food and groups of animal feedstuffs. The Codex Classification is intended to promote harmonization of the terms used to describe commodities which are subject to maximum residue limits and of the approach to grouping commodities with similar potential for residue for which a common group maximum residue limit can be set.

label: a.  primary food commodities of plant origin (ccpr)
subClassOf [LABEL]: Codex Alimentarius classification of food and feed commodities

label: 02  vegetables (ccpr)
subClassOf [LABEL]: a. primary food commodities of plant origin (ccpr)
definition:
Vegetables are foods derived from many different kinds of plants mostly annual and usually cultivated, commonly known by custom and tradition as "vegetables".
In several countries, some of these commodities grown on large areas are distinguished as "field crops" or arable crops e.g. sugar beet. For the sake of convenience in this guide such crops are classified under Type 2 Vegetables.
Exposure to pesticides is dependent on the particular part of the plant used for food and the growing practices.
Vegetables may be consumed in whole or in part and in the form of fresh, dried or processed foods.

label: 015  pulses (vd) (ccpr)
definition:
Pulses are derived from the mature seeds naturally or artificially dried, of leguminous plants known as beans (dry) and peas (dry).
The seeds in the pods are protected from most pesticides applied during the growing season except pesticides which show a systemic action. The dried beans and peas however are often exposed to post-harvest treatments.
The dry pulses are consumed after processing or household cooking.

label: eurofir food classification
subClassOf [LABEL]: European Union agency food product type

label: seafood or related product (eurofir)
definition: The group includes marine or freshwater fish, molluscs, crustaceans, and other fauna such as reptiles, insects or frogs not in the Meats group. The group also includes seafood product analogs and seafood-based sausage or luncheon meat as well as such products as squid ink and clam juice.

label: seafood product (eurofir)
definition: includes fish offal; a food product whose predominant constituent is fish (e.g. dried and salted fish, smoked fish, canned fish, pickled fish, restructured fish and fish analogues, surimi; fish paste, pâté).

label: beverage (non-milk) (eurofir)
definition: Alcoholic or non-alcoholic beverage; excludes milk and milk-based beverages.

label: non alcoholic beverage (eurofir)
definition: Beverage containing no more than 0.5% alcohol; it may be flavoured, sweetened or carbonated; includes soft drinks and steeped beverages; excludes milk in all forms, fruit juices and vegetable juices.

label: coffee, tea, cocoa or infusion (eurofir)
definition: Beverage prepared by extracting flavour and other components from food sources by percolation and/or immersion in water, usually at near-boiling temperature. The group includes coffee (e.g. instant coffee, coffee and chicory essence), tea, herbal tea (e.g. green tea, black tea, tisane), cocoa beverage and beverage powder.

label: miscellaneous food product (eurofir)
definition: EFG group 32, Eurocode-2 group 12.

label: prepared food product (eurofir)
definition: This subgroup includes multicomponent meals, sauces, retail salads, desserts, soups, snacks and other foods where similarity of the product type is more significant than the source of the principal ingredient(s).

label: soup (eurofir)
definition: A liquid food made by simmering meat, poultry, seafood or vegetables, being clear or thickened to the consistency of a thin puree or having milk or cream added, and often containing pieces of solid food such as meat, shellfish, pasta or vegetables. Soup takes precedence over other food products. Examples are egg and lemon soup, oxtail soup, fish soup, rice soup, lentil soup, minestrone, cherry soup.

label: GS1 Global Product Classification (GPC)
definition:
The Global System 1 (GS1) Global Product Classification (GPC) is a system that gives buyers and sellers a common language for grouping products in the same way, everywhere in the world.$br/$
The GS1 GPC classification in facet A is currently updated based on June 2017 release of GS1 GPC Standard for Food/Beverage/Tobacco, except for codes pertaining to tobacco. See the GS1 site for details [https://www.gs1.org/standards/gpc].

label: U.S. code of federal regulations, title 21 food product type
definition: Food and Drugs, title 21, Code of Federal Regulations. Original food classification in LanguaL.

label: sugar
definition: A broad term that includes the nutritive sweeteners dextrose, fructose, galactose, lactose, maltose and sucrose, which are simple carbohydrates with molecules composed of one or two saccharide units. Note that on a product label or in a recipe, 'sugar' means *SUCROSE* and should be so indexed. Use the broad term *SUGAR* only if the specific sugar used is not known or not listed in the vocabulary.

label: carbohydrate extract, concentrate, or isolate
subClassOf [LABEL]: extract, concentrate or isolate of plant or animal
definition: Extract, concentrate or isolate high in sugar, oligosaccharide or polysaccharide.

label: brown sugar
definition: Soft sugar whose crystals are covered by a film of refined dark syrup that imparts color, flavor, and moisture.

label: extract, concentrate or isolate of plant or animal
definition: A physical-chemical component separated from the food source or its parts by extraction, centrifugation, filtration, heat processing, expressing or a similar process. The separated component may be converted through further processing. If this is done, the final substance is indexed. A water-extracted component may remain in aqueous dispersion. The extract, concentrate or isolate is indexed in preference to the anatomic part from which it is derived. For example, peanut oil is indexed under *PEANUT* combined wih *FAT OR OIL* rather than with *SEED OR KERNEL*. On the other hand, fruit and vegetable juices can be indexed under *FRUIT JUICE OR NECTAR* or *VEGETABLE JUICE* (A. PRODUCT TYPE); therefore the anatomic part of the plant should be indexed.

label: mammalian milk whey
definition: The serum or watery part of milk that is separated from the thicker or more coagulable part or curd, espcially in the process of making cheese; it contains lactose, minerals and lactalbumin.

label: seed oil
definition: The oil produced by pressing or extracting lipids from plant seeds (e.g. grapeseed oil, rapeseed oil, linseed oil) /AM

label: food (liquid, low viscosity)
definition: A liquid that flows very easily at room temperature. Examples are: water, apple juice, sherry, acidophilus milk, whipping cream and some heavy liqueurs. The range of low viscosity liquid spans sucrose solutions between 0 and 45% solids (viscosity range from 1 to 10 centipoise). Prefer 'solid pieces' factor term to 'small particles' if both appear in the food.

label: food (liquid)
definition: A state of matter between a solid and a gas, in which a substance has the capacity to flow and conforms to the shape of the container. Liquids range from water to honey, corresponding to a range in viscosity (or apparent viscosity) from 1 to 500 centipoise (viscosity is a measure of a liquid's resistance to flow). Products that are pourable but have a higher viscosity are *SEMILIQUID*.
